body:
A new version of `tzdata`, (`tzdata-2016g`), was released yesterday. From the [changelog](http://mm.icann.org/pipermail/tz-announce/2016-September/000041.html):

> Several zones in Antarctica and the former Soviet Union, along
     with zones intended for ships at sea that cannot use POSIX TZ
     strings, now use numeric time zone abbreviations instead of
     invented or obsolete alphanumeric abbreviations.  The affected
     zones are [...] **Etc/GMT+1** [...]

`Etc/GMT+1` is exactly the zone parsed in the failing test.
